result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
2:47 PM (64-06) Defendant Frederick M Taylor appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Paul Garland Bonneson in court for Frederick M Taylor.  Attorney Andrew Herrmann in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Matter was scheduled for a preliminary hearing but the defendant wishes to waive his right to a preliminary hearing.  Response by Counsel and defendant to Court's questions.  Court finds defendant freely, knowingly and voluntarily waives his right to a preliminary hearing and binds the defendant over. 

State is requesting 30 days for Arraignment Hearing.

Arraignment scheduled for November 22, 2022 at 01:15 pm.

Defendant Frederick M Taylor in court, in custody by video.  Prosecuting attorney Andrew Herrmann in court for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Compton withdrawn, SPD to re-appoint. Minutes filed.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for September 15, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Frederick M Taylor in court, in custody by video. Attorney Andrew Herrmann in court for State of Wisconsin. Minutes filed.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for September 8, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
Preliminary hearing on September 19, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
State's Non-Speedy Reset Request - PH - 09-09-22

3:03 PM (64-06) Defendant Frederick M Taylor appeared by video.  Plaintiff State of Wisconsin in court.  ADA Berg in court for the State. Attorney Jerimiah Maynard appears as a friend of the court.
Attorney Maynard states the Public Defender is still not able to find a Public Defender to represent the defendant. SPD's Office is requesting 2-3 weeks to schedule.
Statement given by defendant, states he has been sitting in Jail for 4 months, spoke with SPD's Office and they said it is up to the Court to appoint an attorney. Court advised the defendant if he did not qualify for a SPD then he could request a court appointed attorney.

2:47PM (64-06) Defendant Frederick M Taylor appeared by video.  Plaintiff State of Wisconsin ADA Berg in court. Attorney Steve Compton in court appearing specially.
Attorney Compton made a record SPD is unable to find an attorney for the defendant.
No objection from the State.
Time limits are waived.

Adj. 2:48PM
Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 12, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

Mackenzie Renner

*AMENDMENT 4/21/2022: N.O. REMOVED FROM CO-ACTOR LIST.

BOND TO COVER 22GF391, 22CF220, 21CF156

Defendant shall not possess or consume alcohol.  Defendant shall not drive a motor vehicle without a valid driver's license.  Defendant shall not possess or use illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.  Any prescribed medication is to be taken within the terms / limits of the prescription.  Defendant will not possess any guns or other weapons. No firearms. Defendant will not in any way contact or attempt to contact any co-actor(s) listed and will avoid their residence/place of employment or any place they are located and will avoid causing any other person, other than defendant's attorney, from doing so on defendant's behalf.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as through the mail, by telephone, by way of electronic device, in person, or through a third party.  CO-ACTOR(S)/RESIDENCE(S): KENNETH CHADWICK, KRISTAL GEHRKE, JILLIAN LEIGHTON, MICHELLE LYONS, SEAN MASON, CHRISTOPHER MCGADDEN, JOSHUA POTTER, THOMAS SCHULTZ & BRYAN TIDWELL.   Defendant shall personally ensure that payments are made under any Order for Income Withholding if the Court appoints an attorney for the defendant.
Signed bond filed with the court.

Prosecuting attorney Vivien L. TenHaken in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Frederick M Taylor in court, in custody. Attorney Mackenzie Renner appeared specially. May 9th date removed. Minutes filed.
Initial appearance scheduled for May 4, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
